places_with_reviews.name: Krishna Mutt

reviews.text:
One of best place to visit in udupi anytime .
Especially evenings the best time over here

Historical place filled with positive vibes .
Must visit place in Udupi.

It's one of the best spiritual places
You will get peace  once you enter Rathabeedhi.
Lots of shops are there shopping
Parking is available and luggage room also available.
Ananteshwara, Chandramouleshwara and  Ragavendra Swamy  temple must visit places at Rathabeedhi.

You will get afternoon lunch as a prasdha
Usually crowd is too much in weekend ans special days
Have to stand in Queue for at least 1 hour if you are planning to take darshana in the morning around 8 to 9 AM.

The temple is beautiful.
There are many Mutt.

Mesmerizing experience at the evening aarti !!!

We went at 6.00pm , very less crowd, we had the most amazing experience. The evening ritual ( seva) starts at 6.30 pm , they light hundreds of diyas in the mandir and the evening Aarti enfolds accompanied by lots of musicians playing traditional musical instruments. Post that the deity is taken in a palaquin( palkhi) around the Krishna mutt. Then on the boat in the sarovar all accompanied by the procession of musicians. This around 7.30 pm . Post that the diety is kept on huge almost 30 feet raths , pulled by the devotees .The raths are beautifully illuminated!!! There is traditional Indian music being played. It's a mesmerizing experience. This happens DAILY (except the monsoons ) . This tradition is going on for centuries. It's like time has stopped here, centuries ago ,terms of rituals and traditions being followed. The ambiance too is amazing

places_with_reviews.name: Shri Tirumala Venkataramana Swamy Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Bantwal Market Rd, Bantwal, Amtady, Karnataka 574211, India

reviews.text: This is a divine place to visit as a bhaktha. When you see the lord Tirumala swami, who is famously known as "Vatapuresha"🙏🙏, you will be very emotional with full of bhakti towards him. It is a Old ancient temple  with vast beautiful Netravati river behind the temple. Famous thing in this temple is 'Bantwala Mrigabete' and 'Bantwala Rathotsava', where lot of bhakthas visit this temple with famous jasmine flower to God. This is one of the famous and powerful  temple of GSB community❤.

Bantwal Sri Tirumala venkatramana temple on the banks of river nethravathi built in a unique architectural style by the local GSB Community is a real Marvel in its stature as well in Beauty & Divinity.The Lord Venkatramana is also popularly called as Vatapuresha and is the Ishtadevatha for the local Konkani speaking community which population is more of Baligas.People throng this temple during Lalki utsav and theru.Offering Jasmine flower during these utsav is so beautiful fragrant and divine.Thanks to the GSB community who are continuing the age old tradition without any compromise on the customs and  the sanctity of the temple as a whole.Bantwala grama devu venkatesha raakha thu.

this is a very old temple around 15th century temple of Sri Thirumala Venkataramana Swamy. the temple complex is big . The deity is very nicely decorated and the worship is done with great devotion. The temple has sub-shrines to shri Garuddev, shri Hanuman, Goddess shri Lakhsmi and shri ganesh. the structure is old and the old structure is maintained.

A temple which one should visit when one visits temple in this area.
Peaceful and spiritual place right next to netravati river with lots of fishes and can spend time at River side.
A very old temple belonging to the community of GSB Konkani speaking community built somewhere in the 16th century

places_with_reviews.name: Church Of Most Holy Saviour, Agrar
places_with_reviews.address: Ponnangila, Ponnagila, Agrar Post via Bantwal, Post via, Agrar, Bantwal, Karnataka 574211, India

reviews.text:
The church was built in 1702,
It is the one of the oldest churches in Dakshina Kannada district.

The exterior of the Church Of Most Holy Saviour stands as a testament to the craftsmanship and dedication that went into its construction. The intricate architecture and the majestic bell tower create a visual symphony of faith and artistry. It's a sight that captures the essence of the divine even before stepping inside.

the Church Of Most Holy Saviour in Agrar, Bantwal, is not just a place of worship, but a sanctuary of solace and devotion. It's a place where one can connect with the divine, find comfort in a supportive community, and experience a profound sense of spirituality. Whether you're a devoted believer or simply seeking a moment of inner peace, a visit to this church promises an encounter with the sacred that will resonate long after you've left its sacred halls.

Most Holy Saviour church is in Agrar, Bantwal Taluk. One of the oldest churches in Mangalore Diocese.
The paintings on the ceiling near the Alter are very beautiful.
An outdoor hall is being constructed this year(2018) which will be probably open for the benefit of the parishioners by this December.

One of the oldest church in Mangalore.
Very good place for prayer.
Parking facility is available.

Nice church it also has a 300 years old history initially it has been built by British and later it was rebuilt. Inside this church there are many statues and paintings on the wall. It has a big ground and parking lot. It has its own schools. It's an good place, nice and pollution free environment.
One of the ancient churches of Mangalore. Beautiful paintings are found here like st Aloysius College Chapel. Visit once to experience the peace of mind.

places_with_reviews.name: River view point

reviews.text: Nice view point of the Netravati river just on the side of the main road from Bantwal to Beltangady. Now there seems to be some bridge or dam construction in progress in this place so view is slightly disturbed also be careful of a steep sudden drop in the end of the view point.

Located in the bantwal Dharmasthala highway
It's a bridge where you can see a landscape view of the netravati river
There is also a pump house here
If you are passing by this highway you can stop for a few minutes and enjoy the view of the river
Best during monsoon when the river is full

Gem of a place in the middle of nowhere! The problem is it's very easy to miss as you are driving on the highway from BC road to Belthangadi, and this beautiful view will escape you in a fraction of a second. Better to visit early morning, and excellent photography opportunity. Great picnic space too. But be careful not to disturb the natural ecosystem and the HW by the side. Park your car in a safe place and keep an eye on your children.
Good
Nice places
